title: Manifest
description: A JSON Schema to validate wasmCloud Application Deployment Manager (WADM) manifests

apiVersion.description: The specific version of the Open Application Model specification in use

kind.description: The entity type being described in the manifest

annotations.description: A set of string key/value pairs used as arbitrary annotations on this application configuration.

spec.description: Configuration attributes for various items in the lattice

opconfigVariable.description: The Variables section defines variables that may be used elsewhere in the application configuration. The variable section provides a way for an application operator to specify common values that can be substituted into multiple other locations in this configuration (using the [fromVariable(VARNAME)] syntax).

name.description: The parameter's name. Must be unique per configuration.
name.$comment: Some systems have upper bounds for name length. Do we limit here?

applicationScope.description: The scope section defines application scopes that will be created with this application configuration.

name.description: The name of the application scope. Must be unique to the deployment environment.

type.description: The fully-qualified GROUP/VERSION.KIND name of the application scope.

properties.description: The properties attached to this scope.

wasmComponent.description: This section defines the instances of components to create with this application configuration.

name.description: The name of the component to create an instance of.

properties.description: Overrides of parameters that are exposed by the application scope type defined in 'type'.

traits.description: Specifies the traits to attach to this component instance.

providerComponent.description: This section defines the instances of providers to create with this application configuration.

name.description: The name of the provider to create an instance of.

properties.description: Overrides of parameters that are exposed by the application scope type defined in 'type'.

traits.description: Specifies the traits to attach to this component instance.

componentProperties.description: Values supplied to parameters that are used to override the parameters exposed by other types.

image.description: The image reference to use for the component.
image.$comment: Some systems have upper bounds for name length. Do we limit here?

id.description: The component identifier to use for the component. Will be autogenerated if not supplied.

providerProperties.description: Values supplied to parameters that are used to override the parameters exposed by other types.

image.description: The image reference to use for the provider.
image.$comment: Some systems have upper bounds for name length. Do we limit here?

id.description: The component identifier to use for the provider.

trait.description: The trait section defines traits that will be used in a component instance.

type.description: The trait type for the instance, whether spreadscaler or link

properties.description: Overrides of parameters that are exposed by the trait type defined in 'type'.

target.description: The target this link applies to. This should be the name of a component in the manifest

source_config.description: Configuration properties for the source of the link

target_config.description: Configuration properties for the target of the link

spreadscalerProperties.description: A properties object (for spreadscaler configuration) is an object whose structure is determined by the spreadscaler property schema. It may be a simple value, or it may be a complex object.

items.description: A spread object for spreading replicas.

anyOf.description: A properties object (for trait and scope configuration) is an object whose structure is determined by the trait or scope property schema. It may be a simple value, or it may be a complex object.
